SPScript Docs
Namespace: queryString

queryString

Source:
  • queryString.js, line 3

Methods

(static) fromObj(obj, [quoteValues]opt) → {string}

Turns a normal js Object into a string in form of "key1=value1&key2=value2..."
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
obj Object Javascript object to query stringify
[quoteValues] bool <optional>
 By default, if the value has a space, it will be single quoted. Passing true will cause all values to be quoted.
Source:
  • queryString.js, line 7
Returns:
- Note: tt does NOT prepend '?' char
Type
string
Example
var myObj = { id: 123, title: "My Title" }
var qs = SPScript.queryString.fromObj(myObj);
// qs would output: "id=123&title='MyTitle'"

(static) toObj(str) → {Object}

Turns a string in form of "key1=value1&key2=value2..." into a javascript object
Parameters:
Name Type Description
str string must be in query string format to work
Source:
  • queryString.js, line 35
Returns:
- A javascript object with properties for each key found in the query string passed in.
Type
Object
Example
// your url is "https://sharepoint.com/sites/mysite/home.aspx?id=123&title='My Title'"
var myObj = SPScript.queryString.toObj(window.location.search);
//myObj would be { id: 123, title: "My Title" }
